column4: we have two computers connected to one wifi router at home. how can we share files?
there are many ways.. you can use the windows file sharing protocol with samba, !samba for more info, or try nfs, ftp or any of the others that are available
I don't think there is a repository for the latest flash
are you using 32 or 64 bit ubuntu?
then you can get the latest flash plugin from adobe and install that..but you'll have to be prepared to fix any problems yourself.. going with the one in the repos is always the easiest way
any other rule? no 1 or 0 no avoid?
192.168.X.X should work nicely
192.168.0.1 is a good start.. I don't think you're allowed to have 192.168.0.0  though
got that. just have to avoid having the same ip as other devices. thanks
it also broke my internet access :| if i use more conventional ip adds they dont remain static
try using 192.168.1.1 instead.. 192.168.0.1 is a common default for home routers and such
apparently, i needed a one that is not along my dhcp range. so there are two requirements, something that will remain static and is not along the dhcp range. how do I know? hehe
what ip do you have on your desktop computer? type "ifconfig" in a terminal to find out
then go with 10.0.1.1 for your iphone
you can basically change anything but the 10... so 10.2.3.4 would also work
and scunizi thanks :)
cant go online with 10.2.3.4
are you using some kind of router/gateway thingy?
i have a wifi router connected to a wired router which is connected to my dsl
it's probably something that the router is doing then
